results.title: At Patantja clay pan
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “People of the Australian western desert (A)”.
Daily activities of two families camped near a clay pan holding water, showing desert food resources in a good season. The men hunt emus and the women collect mulga seed, ngaru fruit and grubs.

results.title: At long last
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer, ONF | NFB and John Ralph
results.brief_description: A guided tour through the interior and behind the scenes of the new National Library of Canada in Ottawa showing modern devices for information storage and retrieval - teletype, computers, microfilm and an exhaustive card catalogue.

results.title: At Henley
results.creator_credit: Verity Films, Film Producers Guild and Seafield Head
results.brief_description: The work of the Administrative Staff College at Henley where a method of managerial development is used to give further training to men and women in their late thirties and early forties. The work and final reports of some of the groups are shown.

results.title: At dawn: overcoming all fears
results.brief_description: Second in the nine-episode series “The History book”; an animated history of Western Civilization, this film examines Vasco da Gama’s voyages to Africa and India in 1497-99, his attempts to trade Portuguese goods for African and Indian goods, and the resultant violence by the Portuguese when the people in these countries refused to comply. Suitable for Lower Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: At 'Edge' with Judith Wright
results.creator_credit: Sync or Swim Documentaries and Solrun Hoaas
results.brief_description: A study of Judith Wright, her poetry and her links with the Australian landscape - in particular her relation to her property of “Edge” in Mangarlowe, N.S.W. Filmed at “Edge” in the Half-moon Wildlife District and featuring Roger Pulvers as the interviewer. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: Asylum
results.creator_credit: Harbour productions, Amicus Productions, Max J Rosenberg, Milton Subotsky and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: Are the patients incurably insane or just part of the occult? A young psychiatric doctor (Robert Powell) visits an asylum where he is to have a short residency. Upon arriving he finds out the director/leading doctor has now become a patient and is upstairs with the other sick people. There are four patients and the young doctor is to guess which of the patients is the now mad Dr B. Starr and in doing so, will get to keep the job. One by one we learn the patient’s bizarre stories. The first story is of a young woman (Barbara Parkins) involved with a married man - he chops up his wife and puts her in a freezer. The young woman visits but finds the man in the freezer instead and she is attacked. The next story stars Peter Cushing as a customer of a tailor, he wants the tailor to make a suit for his dead son to be re-incarnated but the plans go array. The next patient is a delusional young girl (Charlotte Rampling) who has a split personality ‘Lucy’ (Britt Ekland) upon who she blames the murder of her brother and nurse. The final patient used to be a doctor and makes creepy robot models that have fully functioning brains and murderous intentions. Scary fun stuff with appropriate orchestral music to make sure you know when something weird is about to happen and the final twist reveals just who is Dr Starr.

results.title: Asya's Happiness
results.brief_description: Asya Klyashina is a cook in a small Russian village, lame and unmarried. During harvest time she works at a field camp where she renews acquaintance with Sasha, a driver returned from the city, who announces that he loves her but has no thought of marriage. Mothers look after their children amid the harvest; the men reminisce about the Patriotic War (“fighting for the Motherland, for Stalin”) and about the prison camps after the war. But complications to her life start when Asya discovers she is pregnant by another youth, Stephan.

results.title: Astrozoology 101
results.brief_description: An animation using the cutout techniques pioneered by Lotte Reiniger that revises the fairytale ‘The Frog Prince’. In this version the princess is a devouring alien.

results.title: Astronomy: an Open Learning unit
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, Monash University, Open University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: This astronomy series features the southern skies particularly the work being done in Australia by scientists and astronomers who are trying to unravel the secrets of the universe. These programs are part of an Open Learning unit and can be viewed in conjunction with the series entitled “Universe: the infinite frontier.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Hollander, Monash University, Open University and ABC-TV (Australia)
